intro: Sphaeralcea valparidisea, commonly known as the Valparaiso globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. Sphaeralcea valparidisea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
